intro: Eremogone macradenia, commonly known as the broad-leaved eremogone, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are broad and often hairy, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact head, and bloom during the warmer months.
